sen.j: 散髪脱刀令（さんぱつだっとうれい）とは、明治4年8月9日 (旧暦)（1871年9月23日）に明治政府によって出された太政官布告。
sen.e: Zanpatsu Dattō Rei is a edict of the Grand Council of State submitted by Meiji government in September 23rd, 1871.
Zanpatsu Datto Rei is an edict of the Grand Council of State submitted by Meiji government in September 23, 1871.
sen.cmt: a edict からan edictと修正しました。日付の表記を修正しました。「ō」の使用について；ouとはしていませんが、oのみではありません。エクセル上で単語の一部として認識されないようなので、oに変更しました。
sen.e: Zanpatsu Datto Rei is an edict of the Grand Council of State submitted by Meiji government in September 23, 1871.

sen.j: 一般には、断髪令という名称で呼ばれる。
sen.e: In general, it is called "Dampatsu Rei" for cutting topknots.
In general, it is called "Dampatsu Rei" for cutting topknots.
In general, it is called "Dampatsu Rei" for cutting topknots.

sen.j: 幕末に洋式軍制の導入が始まって以後、ちょんまげを結わずに散髪する風潮が広まりつつあったが、この日「散髪脱刀勝手たるべし」として髪型については勝手にし、華族・士族が刀を差さなくても構わないとした（なお、庶民の帯刀については前年12月27日 (旧暦)（1871年2月16日）に改めて禁止令が出されている）。
sen.e: From this day on, noble and warrior class formally gained a freedom of forming their own hairstyle, and not being required to yield their swords at all time, although the tendency of not knotting the top-hair has already seen common due to incorporation of Western-styled military after the collapse of Bakufu.

Although the tendency of not knotting the top-hair was already common since Western-styled military system was adapted in the last days of Tokugawa Shogunate, the edict formally given a freedom of forming their own hairstyle and noble and warrior class to not yield their swords at all time, stating 'one shall chose to have hair cut or to leave one's sword' (a prohibition was issued regarding to common people to wear a sword in the previous year, February 16, 1871).
sen.cmt: 「（なお、庶民の帯刀については前年12月27日 (旧暦)（1871年2月16日）に改めて禁止令が出されている）」が訳漏れです。Althoughと文中に出てくるので、こちらを文頭に移動し、その他の箇所も書き直しました。「幕末に」とあるのでafter the collapse of Bakufuは誤訳です。
sen.e: Although the tendency of not knotting the top-hair was already common since Western-styled military system was adapted in the last days of Tokugawa Shogunate, the edict formally given a freedom of forming their own hairstyle and noble and warrior class to not yield their swords at all time, stating 'one shall chose to have hair cut or to leave one's sword' (a prohibition was issued regarding to common people to wear a sword in the previous year, February 16, 1871).

sen.j: なお、例外規定として「官吏等礼服の時は帯刀すべし」とされている。
sen.e: On a side note, government officials were still required to yield sword in a case of formal attire.
It stated that 'government officials should still be required to yield sword in a case of formal attire' as an exception to the rules.
sen.cmt: 文をIt statedで始め、例外として（On a side note）を文末に移動しました。
sen.e: It stated that 'government officials should still be required to yield sword in a case of formal attire' as an exception to the rules.

sen.j: なお、勘違いされることもあるが、散髪脱刀令は髷を禁止して散髪を強制する布告ではなく、髪型を自由にして構わないという布告である。
sen.e: It is a common misconception that Zanpatsu Dattō Rei by all mean ordered the forcible hair cutting by forbidding topknots, but rather, it conveyed a freedom of hairstyle.
It is a common misconception that Zanpatsu Datto Rei by all mean ordered the forcible hair cutting by forbidding topknots, but rather, it conveyed a freedom of hairstyle.
sen.cmt: 「ō」の使用について；ouとはしていませんが、oのみではありません。エクセル上で単語の一部として認識されないようなので、oに変更しました。
sen.e: It is a common misconception that Zanpatsu Datto Rei by all mean ordered the forcible hair cutting by forbidding topknots, but rather, it conveyed a freedom of hairstyle.

sen.j: 榊原鍵吉のように、布告以降も髷をしていた者もいたが、特に罰せられてはいない。
sen.e: People like Kenkichi SAKAKIBARA kept his topknot even after the edict was officially announced, but was not punished in any ways.
People like Kenkichi SAKAKIBARA kept his topknot even after the edict was officially announced, but was not punished in any ways.
People like Kenkichi SAKAKIBARA kept his topknot even after the edict was officially announced, but was not punished in any ways.

sen.j: これを受けて明治6年（1873年）3月には明治天皇も散髪を行い、官吏を中心にこれに従うものが増えていった。
sen.e: In March 1873, The Meiji Emperor as well as other major government officials also cut their hairs.
In March 1873, The Meiji Emperor had his haircut and then many, mainly government officials, also followed and had haircut.
sen.cmt: The Meiji Emperor をthe Meiji Emperor と修正しました。明治天皇が散髪した後にそれに従うものが増えた、という意味なので、そのように書き換えました。
sen.e: In March 1873, The Meiji Emperor had his haircut and then many, mainly government officials, also followed and had haircut.

sen.j: だが、この法令の目的の1つには廃藩置県を受けて、旧武士に対する特権廃止の一環として帯刀の禁止が検討されたものの、「武士の魂」と信じられていた刀を直ちに取り上げることは士族反乱につながる可能性がある為に様子見の一環として出されたとされている。
sen.e: For its modest sentiment, the purpose of Zanpatsu Dattō Rei is now recognized as the very first attempt to take away the rights of warrior class, of whom could cause the uprising if the policy simply forced seizure of their swords.

For its modest sentiment, the purpose of Zanpatsu Datto Rei is now recognized as the very first attempt to prohibit wearing a sword as a part of policy to take away the rights of warrior class, of whom could cause the uprising if the policy simply forced seizure of their swords, which were believed to be 'the soul of samurai'.
sen.cmt: 「ō」の使用について；ouとはしていませんが、oのみではありません。エクセル上で単語の一部として認識されないようなので、oに変更しました。「一環として帯刀の禁止が検討されたものの」「「武士の魂」と信じられていた」が訳漏れです。上記を加えました。
sen.e: For its modest sentiment, the purpose of Zanpatsu Datto Rei is now recognized as the very first attempt to prohibit wearing a sword as a part of policy to take away the rights of warrior class, of whom could cause the uprising if the policy simply forced seizure of their swords, which were believed to be 'the soul of samurai.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を調整

sen.j: ちなみに、翌明治5年4月5日 (旧暦)（1872年5月11日）に東京府が「女子断髪禁止令」を出している。
sen.e: Nonetheless, in May 11th 1872, Province of Tokyo proposed "Jyoshi Dampatsu Kinshi Rei" (The order of prohibition of haircutting for women)
In May 11, 1872, Tokyo Prefecture issued "Jyoshi Danpatsu Kinshi Rei" (The order of prohibition of haircutting for women).
sen.cmt: Nonetheless,が必要ないので削除します。Tokyo Prefectureと変更します。Proposedをissuedと変更します。日付の表記を修正しました。DampatsuをDanpatsuと修正しました。ピリオドが無いので加えました。
sen.e: In May 11, 1872, Tokyo Prefecture issued 'Jyoshi Danpatsu Kinshi Rei' (The order of prohibition of haircutting for women).

sen.j: これは散髪脱刀令の趣旨を「女子も散髪すべきである」と誤解した女性が男性同様の短髪にすることがあったためである。
sen.e: This policy was created as the women misunderstood the true meaning of Zanpatsu Dattō Rei and started to cut their hair.
This policy was created as women misunderstood the true meaning of Zanpatsu Datto Rei and started to have their hair short.
sen.cmt: 「短髪」の短いが訳漏れです。The womenのtheは必要ないかと思います。「ō」の使用について；ouとはしていませんが、oのみではありません。エクセル上で単語の一部として認識されないようなので、oに変更しました。
sen.e: This policy was created as women misunderstood the true meaning of Zanpatsu Datto Rei and started to have their hair short.

sen.j: 福井県では断髪令に反対する一揆が発生し、6人が騒乱罪で死刑となっている。
sen.e: In Fukui Prefecture, one group which opposed Zanpatsu Dattō Rei caused uprising, resulting the death penalty of six individuals
In Fukui Prefecture, one group which opposed Zanpatsu Datto Rei caused uprising, resulting the death penalty of six individuals
